title._content: [East Hampton Free Library, 159 Main Street, East Hampton, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. [East Hampton Free Library, 159 Main Street, East Hampton, New York. Lawn] [ca. 1915] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. Building: Library designed by Aymar Embury II, completed 1912. Landscape: Ruth Bramley Dean. Today: Library extant. On slide (handwritten): "East Hampton. Also, blue star sticker, red seal sticker, and gold star sticker. Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Subjects: Gardens--New York (State)--East Hampton--1910-1920. Fountains--New York (State)--East Hampton--1910-1920. Sculpture--New York (State)--East Hampton--1910-1920. Format: Lantern slides--Hand-colored--1910-1920. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16242 Call Number: LC-J717-X100- 33
